title: updated dependencies
Documentation missing for  agent  option
body: request  accepts a http/https Agent as  agent  option  but it s not documented. What is documented is how to pass a pool of agents as  pool  option  but the code first checks if  self.agent  exists before using  self.pool  to get the http agent:  https://github.com/request/request/blob/2ca06330c9e8d438b07c9efd9a077303d2e59ec8/request.js L486 L490  This should be documented   tested  or it should be removed... Otherwise we cannot rely on it.

title: Documentation missing for the  abort    method
body: Documentation and tests are missing for the  abort    method. It was added by PR  188 a long time ago.  There seem to be some issues with it:  1457.  Also  what are the practical differences between  destroy    and  abort   ? I have a scenario where calling  destroy    doesn t stop the download  whereas  abort    does.

title: Add tests and docs for using the agent  agentClass and agentOptions. Forever option defaults to using http s .Agent in node 0.12
body: Fixes https://github.com/request/request/issues/1637 Fixes https://github.com/request/request/issues/1669  Feedback: @mikeal @devTristan @triccardi systran and anyone else interested in   Take a look at the agent tests [here] https://github.com/simov/request/blob/agent docs/tests/test agent.js . Just a bunch of simple use cases  also note that the  forever  option defaults to  http s .Agent  in node 0.12    Take a look at the [docs] https://github.com/simov/request/tree/agent docs requestoptions callback  as well. A little bit down below there is a section for  agent  related options. It would be great if you read through all of them carefully and let me know if I m not getting something right.

title: Accept req of http server directly
body: Everytime I create a minimal proxy thingy  I have to parse the urls and stuff myself. It d be nice to have request parse them automatically. this is what I have in mind      js http.createServer function  req  resp      var x = request req    x.pipe resp          so it automatically checks for it s http method and pipes the req to itself and other normal stuff that we do each time.

title: HTTPS CONNECT socket
body: I m trying to create a request to my external server and my external server will forward request to the Internet. In my environment  I need to connect to a proxy server first using HTTPS which can be easily done with request module. However  I can t create a HTTPS in HTTPS tunnel using request module because there  s no way for me to directly handle the socket the client open  when CONNECT event fired  to forward the data to external server. Could you implement this?

title: Basic authentication lost upon redirect
body: Request seems to drop its auth arguments on redirection  here is a minimal example:      js var request = require  request  ; require  request  .debug = true;  request       uri :  https://127.0.0.1:8083/fhem?cmd=jsonlist2 XHR=1        auth :            user :  fhem            pass :  xxx            sendImmediately : false            strictSSL: false      rejectUnauthorized: false         function  error  response  body      if   error    response.statusCode == 200        console.log  REQUEST:  body ; Debugging on the  onRequestResponse  method I get the following response:      onRequestResponse http://www.tecnofanatico.com/wp content/uploads/2015/07/Sin t tulo 1 150x150.png 404   date:  Wed  15 Jul 2015 16:04:59 GMT     server:  Apache/2.2.29  Unix  mod_ssl/2.2.29 OpenSSL/1.0.1e fips mod_bwlimited/1.4      x powered by :  PHP/5.4.33     vary:  Cookie      x pingback :  http://www.tecnofanatico.com/xmlrpc.php     expires:  Wed  11 Jan 1984 05:00:00 GMT      cache control :  no cache  must revalidate  max age=0     pragma:  no cache     connection:  close      transfer encoding :  chunked      content type :  text/html; charset=UTF 8         The url is valid and displays an image  but I ve noticed an accented i character     in the filename.  Btw I am using node version  0.12.6 .  So  this is not all.  I tried with node version  0.10.38  and it works...  Here s the debugging output  while using  0.10.38       onRequestResponse http://www.tecnofanatico.com/wp content/uploads/2015/07/Sin t tulo 1 150x150.png 200   date:  Wed  15 Jul 2015 16:13:30 GMT     server:  Apache/2.2.29  Unix  mod_ssl/2.2.29 OpenSSL/1.0.1e fips mod_bwlimited/1.4      last modified :  Wed  01 Jul 2015 15:29:46 GMT     etag:   54603fd 82ed 519d1fe2a7d25       accept ranges :  bytes      content length :  33517      keep alive :  timeout=5  max=100     connection:  Keep Alive      content type :  image/png

title: Version 2.59 is published
body: [Changelog] https://github.com/request/request/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md  :tada:

title: Content Type is not set when using req.form
body: It looks like v2.59.0 and  1650 broke the [sendgrid] https://github.com/sendgrid/sendgrid nodejs  library by making it so  Content Type  is not set when using  req.form   . A refactor is probably in order on our end  but just wanted to share https://github.com/sendgrid/sendgrid nodejs/issues/178.

title: self.setHeader self._form.getHeaders    has no effect due to  undefined  value
body: The  setHeader  on [request.js  L576] https://github.com/request/request/blob/master/request.js L576  has no effect due to its  undefined  value  due to [caseless  index.js  L52] https://github.com/request/caseless/blob/master/index.js L52  .  We can keep the  undefined  value condition  but we must set a value in order to set the headers.  [PR  1686] https://github.com/request/request/pull/1686

title: Fix  1685: setHeader   with undefined value
body: Allow  setHeader  to work by not using an  undefined  value  [Issue  1685] https://github.com/request/request/issues/1685

title: Fix caseless bug   content type not being set for multipart/form data
body: Fixes https://github.com/request/request/issues/1684 Fixes https://github.com/request/request/issues/1685 Closes https://github.com/request/request/pull/1686  As it [turned out] https://github.com/request/request/issues/1684 issuecomment 122978907  a change in  _caseless_ caused  multipart/form data  related headers to not being set.  Thanks for the feedback everyone  and especially @garymathews for fixing it up  your commit is in this PR .  I added the missing check for the  content type  headers in the tests.

title: Version 2.60 is published   important hotfix
body: [Changelog] https://github.com/request/request/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md    anyone using  multipart/form data  requests   should update to 2.60     Related PR   https://github.com/request/request/pull/1687

body: Wherever I m using request  the requests are really slow after the latest MACOS Yosemite upgrade. I upgraded to the latest request package but i m still getting the issue. Is there anything I need to check?  Direct requests to node or any other web application are working fast as usual.

title: Clarify error handling in documentation
body: More information should be provided about the  err  argument in request callbacks. None of the examples seem to describe it properly.  The documentation should probably also specify possible error conditions. Is the err argument only for transport errors  or does it have semantics for HTTP 4xx/5xx codes?

title: IPv6 :: is misinterpreted
body: I ran across this problem in a test scenario. I create an ad hoc express server and tell it to listen on port 0  then get the servers info about address and port in order to request data from it. Pretty standard for test setups. However in node 0.12  0.12.2 in my case  an express server returns IPv6 address info where localhost is represented as  :: . The request module seems to interpret this in a way where any request goes to  /::/path  instead of  /path .  Example setup:      js var express = require  express  ; var request = require  request  ;  var serverInfo = express  .use function  req  res        console.log  URL   req.url ;      res.end  Hello World  ;        .listen 0    .address  ;  var url =  http://    serverInfo.address    :    serverInfo.port;  console.log  requesting   url ;  request url ;      Console output:        node index.js  requesting http://:::44596   using node request module URL /::     using curl URL /

title: forever  option is useless in node 0.12.
body: because it s creates new agents every request  for example:      js var request = Request.forever     maxSockets: 2   ;  var r1 = request  http://google.com   function      ; var r2 = request  http://google.com   function      ;  console.log r1.agent === r2.agent ; //prints false  but should be true      Problem is here https://github.com/request/request/blob/master/request.js L486 .  This can be fixed by replacing this line by something like this:      js self.agentClass = self.httpModule.Agent; self.agentOptions.keepAlive = true;      Such behaviour makes sockets not reusable  because creates new pool agent  every http request.

title: Add ability to detect connect timeouts
body: It s valuable to be able to detect whether a timeout occurred on the  connect  syscall or on the  write / read  syscall of an HTTP request   the former implies that your client can t reach the server and the latter implies the server might not have responded.  For backwards compatibility  and standardization with Unix errno codes  the  code  property of connect timeout errors must remain as  ETIMEDOUT . Instead of changing this value  add a new  connect  property on timeout errors  which is set to true if the error occurred on the  connect  attempt. Clients have to opt in to checking it   in the common read timeout case  it will be set to  false .  Updates the documentation around each timeout to clarify what is going on  and what situations can trigger each timeout.  Updates the README with more accurate documentation about timeout times in the wild. I tried  time curl http://10.255.255.1  and  time curl http://google.com:81  on four different Linux machines  Heroku  boot2docker  Centos on DigitalOcean  a VPS  and the timeout times ranged from 60 seconds to 120 seconds  much longer than the 20 seconds previously suggested.  Updates the README with information on how to detect connection timeout failures.

title: Set certificate expiration to August 2  2018
body: Updates the gen    scripts to take a   days  argument  and set that  days  argument to 3 years from now. I believe without this argument the certificates default to a 30 day expiry. Code lifted from https://github.com/shazow/urllib3/blob/master/dummyserver/certs/README.rst.  Generates new SSL certs with a long expiry.

title: HPE_INVALID_CONSTANT: Add error hint that it might be TCP or other non HTTP endpoint
body: I encountered this error today: https://github.com/EventStore/EventStore/issues/574 The code appears to indicate that something unexpected was found trying to parse data from a connection as an HTTP response. Turned out I was making a POST request to a port with Eventstore s TCP listener instead of the correct HTTP port. I didn t know request would even _try_ connecting to non http endpoints  so it took me some help to understand and diagnose.  I understand now that includes responses that don t begin with  HTTP   but my first google searches led me to believe that the HTTP server was running but had a problem sending responses.  I d like to add a hint if parsing fails on the first byte. Does the error come via request or node s  http  library? Is there an appropriate place in the request codebase to attach extra info to the error?       Actual error:  [Error: Parse Error] bytesParsed: 0  code:  HPE_INVALID_CONSTANT      My suggestion:  [Error: Parse Error] bytesParsed: 0  code:  HPE_INVALID_CONSTANT   message:  Failed at first byte  is this an HTTP response?    1706 is also seeing this error  they are talking to youtube via a proxy server  so possibly one of those sent bad responses?   Here is a repro for making a request to a TCP server:      js require  net   .createServer handler  .listen 9958   localhost  ; function handler connection     connection.write  go away  ;   connection.pipe connection ;   connection.end  ;    require  request   .get   uri:  http://localhost:9958     callback ;  function callback err  res  body     console.log arguments ;   process.exit  ;

title: Q doesn t enjoy POST requests  is okay with GET though.
body: I am using Q promises. Whenever I request with GET method deferred resolves just fine  Whenever I request with POST  deffered doesn t resolve at all.   Example where works:       function fnGet         defer = Q.defer  ;     request  http://google.com/   function err  res  body            defer.resolve  ;         return defer.promise;       ;    fnGet  .then function         console.log  Got document   ; // Is triggered   ;      Where doesnt:      function fnPost         defer = Q.defer  ;     request  url:  http://somesitethatacceptspost.com/form   form:  somekey: value     function err  res  body            defer.resolve  ;         return defer.promise;       ;    fnPost  .then function         console.log  Posted data   ; // Isn t.   ;

title: Mismatch in interface between request and tough cookie for functions getCookieString and setCookie.
body: There is a mismatch in the interface between request and tough cookie  regarding function getCookieString  and indirectly getCookies .  When I want to assign a tough cookie jar  request does the following in  Request.prototype.jar = function  jar   :  cookies = targetCookieJar.getCookieString urihref   However  tough cookie requires a callback as the second or third parameter in CookieJar.prototype.getCookieString  it is not an optional parameter. See https://github.com/SalesforceEng/tough cookie getcookiescurrenturl options cberrcookies and https://github.com/SalesforceEng/tough cookie getcookiestring  Because of this  in getCookieString  tough cookie gets a uri as the first and only parameter. That goes wrong and breaks  because it pops the last argument which it believes is the callback function but really is the uri. It replaces that with a new callback function that returns a cookie string  thinking it replaces the original callback argument but really replaces the uri argument . It applies that to getCookies  so that function only gets the new callback as the first parameter and not the uri.  For now I ve updated request.js in my local project to provide a valid callback function to getCookieString. This callback function needs to set the cookie HTTP header  because getCookieString does not return the cookie string  it must go through the callback. So I ve moved that piece of code and variable  cookies  in function Request.prototype.jar is no longer used:      js     if  targetCookieJar          targetCookieJar.getCookieString urihref  function  err  cookies            //if need cookie and cookie is not empty         if   err    cookies    cookies.length                if  self.originalCookieHeader                    // Don t overwrite existing Cookie header                 self.setHeader  cookie   self.originalCookieHeader    ;     cookies                else                   self.setHeader  cookie   cookies                                  ;            So could you please take a look at getCookiestring and its interface? Thank you.

title: CSRF Token missing in response
body: When a  fetch  request is sent via the request module  the response object does not contain a x csrf token field.

title: request.js does not explicitly set buffer to null which is referenced by a closure
body: On line 1011 of request.js  he variable  buffer  references an array which can become quite large depending on the size of the response body.  Since the  buffer  variable is referenced in a closure and never explicitly set to null  the buffer remains referenced for the life of the response object and can not be garbage collected.  It would be much safer to prevent memory leaks  and minimally more efficient to set  buffer = null  as soon as it is no longer required by this code so that it can be garbage collected.

title: Reuse request agent on redirect
body: Fixes  1304 Closes https://github.com/request/request/pull/1451  The problems I found before the fix:  1. _updateProtocol was incorrect and is redundant with init  .  2. The code was mixing configuration  options.agentClass  with state  self.agentClass . In my opinion  it would be better if the configuration is immutable which shouldn t be deleted on redirection.

title: What s the idea behind this coding style in index.js?
body: Why rather than      javascript // Exports request.Request = require  ./request   request.initParams = initParams  // Backwards compatibility for request.debug Object.defineProperty request   debug       enumerable : true    get : function         return request.Request.debug        set : function debug        request.Request.debug = debug         module.exports = request      You have written this section as such:      javascript // Exports module.exports = request request.Request = require  ./request   request.initParams = initParams  // Backwards compatibility for request.debug Object.defineProperty request   debug       enumerable : true    get : function         return request.Request.debug        set : function debug        request.Request.debug = debug             Basically why assign  request  to  module.exports  before it is fully constructed/initialized?

title: Support for FORM based authentication
body: The jazz.net and many other applications use FORM based authentication and expect the client to be a browser that displays the form  collects the user s credentials and POSTs to an authentication redirect with the j_security_check query string.   It would be helpful if request.js supported FORM based authentication. Ideally this would be done by parsing the HTML returned in the response that initiates the FORM based challenge and determining that this is a FORM that is intended to POST with the j_security_check query. Such parsing could be difficult and unreliable. The Jazz platform works around this issue with a header extension: x com ibm team repository web auth msg with value authrequired to indicate the server has initiated a FORM based authentication challenge. Clients can examine this header on an HTTP response with status code 200 and know they should POST the user s credentials in order to complete the original request.  Since x com ibm team repository web auth msg is an unregistered  non standard header  it would not be appropriate to code this directly into request.js to support FORM based authentication. However  the request.js options could be extended to include properties that specify the header name and value that indicates a FORM based challenge. Clients could then configure the request object to detect and resolve FORM based challenges for their particular server if it provides such headers.  Is this something that could be considered as an extension to request.js? If so  I d be happy to code it up.

title: Add ability to send non JSON body  and receive a parsed JSON response
body: I want a way to send a non JSON body  but receive a JSON body response. Is there a better way to do this?  What I m doing this now is intercepting the data before calling a callback explicitly      javascript var request = require  request  ; // callback is some function passed to my code var callback = function err  resp  body    ;  var options =       json: false  // added for verbosity     body:  some string   ; request.post options  function err  resp  body        if  typeof body ===  string             body = JSON.parse body ;         resp.body = body;           callback err  resp  body ;   ;      I d like to be able to do something like this  note the new  jsonResponse  property       javascript var request = require  request  ; // callback is some function passed to my code var callback = function err  resp  body    ;  var options =       json: false  // added for verbosity     jsonResponse: true      body:  some string   ; request.post options  callback ;

title: unable to parse response with htmlparser or htmlparser2
body: Hello   It has come to my attention  during my experimentation that I am unable to parse the text received from request.get with either the htmlparser or htmlparser2 packages.  In comparison to https.request the string returned is not the same  line breaks wise. I am scarping a human readable page and http.request handler is able to aggregate the data to match the server response in terms of outputting.  But with request.get I am receiving a response that is without line breaks. Therefore I can only assume I am using the package that is not support by requestjs  and am led to question: What is the best way to actually parse out the HTML received from the reqeust.get and requst.post calls?  Thank You.

title: How to pipe bytes to a request dynamically?
body: I have a Node server that accepts a multi part POST  and I want to pipe the POST parts to an open request as soon as the server receives them.  Currently this is done thusly: 1. Receive multi part POST body part 2. Save all POST body parts to file 3. fs.createReadStream file .pipe request   I want to be able to do this: 1. Receive multi part POST body part 2. pipe the body part to request immediately  Is this possible with the existing syntax? Thanks

title: Change request body after pipe to response
body: Hi   I m trying something like the following:      javascript app.all       req  resp  =>    const url =    req.protocol ://some.ip.addr:80  req.originalUrl  ;  req    .pipe request url      .pipe resp ;   ;      And it works perfectly. But I don t know how to proceed next. What I need to do now is to change the body as follows:      </body>  with  <script /> </body>      Any suggestions ?

title: Of cookies and browsers
body: I m in troubles with cookies with this module. I m trying to send a POST request to other service with actual cookies. I have use this code      javascript         var j = request.jar  ;         var cookie = request.cookie req.headers.cookie ;         var url =  http://localhost/api/portal/1/booking ;         j.setCookie cookie  url ;      The problem is that this works in firefox and the console.log jar looks like:      //Firefox jarrrrr   _jar:   store:   idx:   localhost:    /api/portal/1 :   bellahora_portal: Cookie= bellahora_portal=s 3APK00WHjWv1ZCJUICyWPdoU60. 2Fnpm7izsM0D2jD10aPsznDAXR 2Ffr4DWXI8f0c1MeykY; Path=/api/portal/1; complianceCookie=on; _csrf=3xMdA6YJJ6SmMN8SaK2Q5cZ0; hostOnly=true; aAge=0ms; cAge=0ms                   However when I try it with chrome the results looks a bit different:       //Chrome jarrrrr   _jar:   store:   idx:   localhost:    /api/portal/1 :   complianceCookie: Cookie= complianceCookie=on; Path=/api/portal/1; bellahora_portal=s 3AOLglwoAKDRPgHPcHr4vLoiuQ.juIxFQfXJt 2FYvyr5wnrpLIXvwG3S6Vkos3u2Kb9aPeo; _csrf=iPueBdSIgXRRSN1srfDzIQ25; hostOnly=true; aAge=1ms; cAge=1ms                   The result is that then in Chrome request the service doesn t found the user token. I think that te problem becomes for the  complianceCookie from chrome version.  I have looked for a solution but i don t know how to resolve this. Can anyone help me? Thanks

title: json: true  doesn t set Content Type
body: Documentation for the  json  options says:  > json   sets body but to JSON representation of value and adds Content type: application/json header. Additionally  parses the response body as JSON.  This doesn t work for  json: true :      js var request = require  request   var x = request     uri:  http://whatever     json: true    // FIXME this should include  content type: application/json  console.log x.headers  // >   host:  whatever   accept:  application/json         The actual implementation also checks for  self.body :      js if  typeof val ===  boolean       if  self.body  == undefined    self.getHeader  content type    ==  application/x www form urlencoded         self.body = safeStringify self.body      if   self.hasHeader  content type            self.setHeader  content type    application/json                    I m dealing [with an API] https://mesosphere.github.io/marathon/docs/rest api.html delete v2 groups groupid  that expects a  Content Type: application/json  even for a DELETE request without a body  so the existing implementation doesn t work here. I m working around that by explicitly setting the header on every  json: true  request  of which there are many littered through this application.  I suggest changing the implementation to make the   self.hasHeader  content type    check independent of the  self.body  check  so if  val  is a boolean  try to set the header  ignoring the missing body.  If that s acceptable  I can look into creating a patch  at least the implementation change should be straight forward.

title: Document how to use the getHeader method
body: I m trying to use it to retrieve a header from the response  but I haven t been able to figure out how to do it.

title: Login with request
body: I am trying to login with this code but i get always the same Error message it seems like that my forms is wrong.   I am able to Login with Postman and an another Application Angularjs http  without any errors.      js var request = require  request  ;  var options =       method:  POST       url:  https://hostname:8443/EnterpriseController       params:  a: 1       form:            actionType :  authenticateUser            reqObj :  [null username password null 1]             headers:            Content Type :  application/x www form urlencoded;charset=UTF 8              withCredentials: true      rejectUnauthorized: false  ;  request options      function  error  response  body            if  error               console.log  There was an error:   error ;           else               console.log  Request posted successfully    body ;                  ;      Error Message:      body:   ]     n  login_err : true   resp : [null null null 1] n  n      ]     n  login_err : true   resp : [null null null 1] n  n       Thanks

title: Error: self signed certificate in certificate chain
body: I have managed to get the majority of http and https sites I have tested working  however I am having difficulties finding any documentation on the web about this error from  request :        [Error: self signed certificate in certificate chain] code:  SELF_SIGNED_CERT_IN_CHAIN         The URL in question:   https://esta.cbp.dhs.gov/esta/    The debug:      server 0  err : REQUEST   url:  https://esta.cbp.dhs.gov/esta/   server 0  err :   headers: server 0  err :       User Agent :  Mozilla/5.0  Windows NT 6.3; WOW64  AppleWebKit/537.36  KHTML  like Gecko  Chrome/44.0.2403.155 Safari/537.36 OPR/31.0.1889.174   server 0  err :       Accept Language :  en GB en US;q=0.8 en;q=0.6   server 0  err :      Accept:  text/html application/xhtml xml application/xml;q=0.9 image/webp  / ;q=0.8   server 0  err :       Cache Control :  no cache   server 0  err :      Pragma:  no cache   server 0  err :      Connection:  keep alive   server 0  err :      DNT: 1  server 0  err :       Accept Encoding :  gzip   server 0  err :       Upgrade Insecure Requests : 1    server 0  err :   gzip: true  server 0  err :   callback: [Function]   server 0  err : REQUEST make request https://esta.cbp.dhs.gov/esta/      The code      //set the options var options =       url: returnJson.inputData.url      headers:           /  Mimicking the browsers request headers  /          User Agent                     :  Mozilla/5.0  Windows NT 6.3; WOW64  AppleWebKit/537.36  KHTML  like Gecko  Chrome/44.0.2403.155 Safari/537.36 OPR/31.0.1889.174            Accept Language                :  en GB en US;q=0.8 en;q=0.6            Accept                         :  text/html application/xhtml xml application/xml;q=0.9 image/webp  / ;q=0.8            Cache Control                  :  no cache            Pragma                         :  no cache            Connection                     :  keep alive            DNT                            : 1           Accept Encoding                :  gzip            Upgrade Insecure Requests      : 1            gzip : true  ;  request  options   function  error  response  body         log  error  ;   ;      I there another trick I might be missing?

title: json  setting doesn t have effect in  on  data    callback
body: As an example:      request.get       url: url      json: true    function error  response  data        console.log  regular callback:  ;     console.log data ;   .on  data   function data        console.log  on data  callback:  ;     console.log data ;         The  data  at the regular callback is an array  unpacked from the JSON response. The  data  at the  on data   callback is the JSON response as a string.

title: Using options.qs with a unix socket fails
body: When the following request is done:      js request       uri:  http://unix:/var/run/docker.sock:/containers/json          [Some juggling is done] https://github.com/request/request/blob/master/request.js L258  on  request.uri  to make the unix socket work.  request.uri.host  becomes  /var/run/docker.sock .  However  when a query string is provided by the user  for example:       js request       uri:  http://unix:/var/run/docker.sock:/containers/json       qs:   all:  true            Parsing the query string [clobbers the unix socket] https://github.com/request/request/blob/master/request.js L1162 .  request.uri.host  reverts to  unix .

title: Query strings now cooperate with unix sockets
body: Fixes  1766

title: Add node 4.0 to the list of build targets
Socket hang indefinitely when using formData
body: This is a follow up of the issue  1544 .  I created a  minimum viable repo  to reproduce the issue :smile: https://github.com/simonprev/ad gear request hang  The repo uses a file but it hangs everytime I uses the formData.  The error message:    [Error: socket hang up] code:  ECONNRESET

title: Getting incomplete response data
body: Hi   I have been using request since past 1 year and my experience with it has been great so far. I recently added request to a new application and I have been getting following exception when trying to parse JSON data received from http call made:      SyntaxError: Unexpected end of input     at Object.parse  native      at Request._callback  /home/Codes/xxxxxx/lib/aggregate.js:351:32      at Request.self.callback  /home/Codes/xxxxxx/node_modules/request/request.js:372:22      at Request.emit  events.js:98:17      at Request.<anonymous>  /home/Codes/xxxxx/node_modules/request/request.js:1317:14      at Request.emit  events.js:117:20      at IncomingMessage.<anonymous>  /home/Codes/xxxxx/node_modules/request/request.js:1265:12      at IncomingMessage.emit  events.js:117:20      at _stream_readable.js:944:16     at process._tickCallback  node.js:448:13       I tried logging response body received and found that reponse body is truncated. I am getting incomplete response body in callback of request.  Here are my codes:      fs request           url: collectionUrl          timeout: 60000          function error  response  body            if   error    response.statusCode == 200              try               var resData = JSON.parse body.toString  utf 8   ;                       catch err                console.log body ;             console.log err ;             throw err;                       ;        Thanks  Raeesaa

title: why can t I use request to perform crud operation of insert using a get request
body: My simple rest api allow s crud operation using a browser or cli client of curl but I can t trigger the same thing using the same url with same get parameters  programatically  .i.e. I can t use request  curlrequest  node s http way to do the same. What am  I missing.

title: Set default application/json content type when using json option
body: Will set the header when using  json: true  without a body.  Fixes  1759

title: 301 Redirects don t appear in request.redirects array
body: Hi  Is there any reason why 301 redirects do not appear within  res.request.redirects array.  I can access any 302 redirects  that happened during request resolution  but it s ignoring the 301 s and I need to access them.  Any ideas?  Thanks  David

title: Fix typo in README.md
body: Fix spelling mistake from  recommendend  to  recommended

title: Changed word  conjuction  to read  conjunction  in README.md
connecting to https endpoint and getting: Hostname/IP doesn t match certificate s altnames
body: I m trying to connect to an external https REST service on heroku from my localhost with the following code:      request                                url: config.get  host    req.originalUrl                  method: req.method                 function  error  response  body                         I get the following error in the callback:  Hostname/IP doesn t match certificate s altnames:  Host: localhost. is not in the cert s altnames: DNS:_.herokuapp.com  DNS:herokuapp.com  Host: localhost. is not in the cert s altnames: DNS:_.herokuapp.com  DNS:herokuapp.com  if I connect to the same service installed locally everything works correctly  so it should be related with https.  Any help?

title: ETIMEDOUT occured periodically.
body: Hi  I found some issue which request lib didn t disconnect well  It causes ETIMEDOUT periodically     request version ^2.62.0 node version 0.12.7      Error: ETIMEDOUT     at null.<anonymous>  /var/app/current/node_modules/request/request.js:818:15      at wrappedCallback  /var/app/current/node_modules/newrelic/lib/transaction/tracer/index.js:347:23      at wrapped  /var/app/current/node_modules/newrelic/lib/transaction/tracer/index.js:157:28      at wrappedCallback  /var/app/current/node_modules/newrelic/lib/transaction/tracer/index.js:438:66      at wrapped [as _onTimeout]  /var/app/current/node_modules/newrelic/lib/transaction/tracer/index.js:157:28      at Timer.listOnTimeout  timers.js:119:15  150916/172259.405  [request error:]  data: ETIMEDOUT      It works fine only during 30min   60min.  but certain amount of time is reached  all request are ETIMEDOUT during 0.1 0.2sec and then It works fine only during 30 60min. and over and over  after I replace request library to node.js http.request  it works fine. there s no ETIMEDOUT.  when I used forever options:true   certain amount of time is longer than I didn t.       I have relay servers.  client     relay server using request library      A server  this is relay server code below.       javascript function  request reply         var options =           url:  A server URL           qs: request.query           timeout: config.request.timeout       ;     request options  function  error  response  body            if  error                reply error ;             return;           else if  200  = response.statusCode                reply new Error  can not get user reco   statusCode   response.statusCode  ;             return;                   var result = JSON.parse body ;         reply result ;       ;

title: Doc   error event vs. error callback
body: The doc does not mention the difference between the error event and callback on error.  It would be nice if there was a blurb about how the two differ and when the callback would be called but no event would be emitted.  For instance if the URL or options used contain an invalid entry.  For a bad URL you get both en error event and a callback with an error value:      js request  http://0.0.0.0/asdf   function error  response      console.log  error callback  ;   .on  error   function error      console.log  error event  ;     Result: error callback error event      But for a malformed only the callback fires:      js request  i like pizza   function error  response      console.log  error callback  ;   .on  error   function error      console.log  error event  ;   ;  Result: error callback

In addition  the same code above works if I put a file stream in the formData. That s really wierd...  Bg  Kevin

title: Default content type being set with  json: true  breaks code
body: With 2.63.0 and https://github.com/request/request/pull/1772  request re introduces subtle breaking behavior. It is considered bad HTTP to send content types with requests without a body. For example  I just had breaking behavior where I use HMAC authentication to sign API requests and then send that signature with request. Since the content type is included in the signature and now I get a content type that wasn t expected  I get signatures that don t match and everything goes kaboom... I can code around it  but I don t think I should have too.  I also am pretty sure this is actually a regression. I don t have time to do the bug search right now  but years ago  I remember this broke against things like express  in like the 2.x days  where a content type that was sent without a body would result in an error. While it was also an express bug  it was determined that setting a content type without a body was bad form. If you need that behavior  it should be opt in  not the default where these headers matter. While the docs seem to imply it  it  seems much more like a doc bug than anything.  Either way  changes to the default behavior or headers is a big enough change that it needs to done with a bit more caution  perhaps even a major version bump. I would vote for reverting that change  as I think it will probably break for a lot more people.

title: Can you guys add a copyright text?
body: If people want to use request in their project  they should include a copyright  but I haven t found it. It is as simple as add a text file.

title: Revert: Set default application/json content type when using json option  1772
body: Fixes https://github.com/request/request/issues/1783 Fixes  1786

title: Content Type header shoudn t be set on GET
body: https://github.com/request/request/commit/5225289165a0fb060c30e5a71f69704c3450103f always sets  Conent Type  for requests with  json:true  but this shouldn t happen for GET requests.  It s breaking our servers that see the Content Type header and blindly go looking for a body.  We can work around it by downgrading but wanted to call your attention to it.

body: :wave: Hello   We re all trying to keep our software up to date  yet stable at the same time.  This is the first in a series of automatic PRs to help you achieve this goal. It pins all of the dependencies in your  package.json   so you have complete control over the exact state of your software.  From now on you ll receive PRs whenever one of your dependencies updates   in real time. This way you get all the benefits of up to date dependencies  while having them pinned at the same time. This means:   No more surprises because some of your dependencies didn t follow [SemVer] http://semver.org/ . Your software is always in a state you know about  regardless of _when_ someone does    npm install .   If you have continuous integration set up for this repo  it ll run automatically. Ideally  it will pass and you ll stay up to date with the press of a button. If the updated dependency _does_ break your software  it won t affect your users  because their dependencies are still pinned to the working state.   You can immediately identify which dependency updates break your software  because each one is tested in isolation. You ll also have a branch ready to work on  so adapting to new APIs is way faster. title: Request destroy does not destroy the underlying socket
body: After initiating a stream like this:      javascript var streamRequest = request this.url        .on  data    chunk  => this.onData chunk  ;      Data chunks are received as observed in the callback  onData   however  calling      javascript streamRequest.end   streamRequest.destroy        does not close the connection properly. I am still getting data chunks in. It is only through this code here the connection is actually closed:      javascript var streamRequest = request this.url        .on  data    chunk  => this.onData chunk         .on  socket    socket  => this.socket = socket ;  this.socket.end  ; this.socket.destroy  ;      Is this a bug or wrong use of the API?

title: Is request used for testing REST APIs?
body: It seems that [SuperTest] https://github.com/visionmedia/supertest  is the most popular library for testing REST APIs. Given the strengths of _request_  I was wondering if anyone uses it for testing. Is there an overlap with the functionality of SuperTest/SuperAgent? Are the two libraries complementory?  P.S. Please let me know if there is a request forum where I should be posting this question.

title: Socket Hung Up  ECONNRESET error with many https requests
body: Steps to reproduce: Run this simple https server: https://gist.github.com/jeffkile/b93349282c77f345f502 then run this client https://gist.github.com/jeffkile/3bf35e6c8bec4b160ca5 TWICE to make 1000 get requests to the server. The second time you run the client a portion of the requests will fail with the Socket Hung Up error message.  This is reproducible on both node 0.12.7 and node 4.1.  If you specify your own  agent  with   maxSockets: 10  keepAlive: false   then it works.  Is there a bug in request or https or node that is causing this problem? Or does the request documentation need to be updated to tell users they need to specify one of these options? Or is there something subtle in the way connections work that I don t understand?

body: Here is the code:      js var app = require  express    ; var multiparty = require  multiparty  ; var request = require  request  ; var ims = require  imagemagick stream  ; var fs = require  fs  ; var Busboy = require  busboy  ;  app.post  /submit   function httpRequest  httpResponse  next        var form = new multiparty.Form  ;      form.on  part   function part           if part.filename                        var formData =                   thumbnail:                       value:  part                      options:                           filename: part.filename                          contentType: part[ content type ]                                                      ;              request.post  url: http://localhost:7070/store   formData: formData   function  err  httpResponse  body                    if err                        return console.error  upload failed:   err ;                                    console.log  Upload successful   Server responded with:  ;               ;                       form.on  error   function error           console.log error ;             form.parse httpRequest ;        ;  app.get  /   function httpRequest  httpResponse  next        httpResponse.send  <form action= http://localhost:9090/submit  method= post  enctype= multipart/form data ><input type= file  name= file  /><input type= submit  value= xxx  /></form>  ;   ;  app.listen 9090 ;      Here I am uploading the file submitted by user to another server without saving it on disk. title: response pull stream is not working
body: Hi  according to the README  this type of construct      js  .on  response   function response        // unmodified http.IncomingMessage object     response.on ...                   will give me access to unmodified httpIncomingMessage object. Which implements a readable stream.  However  when I try to do something like       js     resp.on  response   function response                response.on  readable   function                         var data = response.read 1000 ;      this gets called but data is always null  Noticed that doing      js     resp.on  response   function response                response.on  data   function data                 does indeed give me the data  but this is a  push  stream which is not acceptable to me. I need to be able to use a  pull  stream  where my code decides when to get the data from the stream and how much of it  etc. Please help Thanks Greg

title: Enable loose cookie parsing in tough cookie
body: tough cookie 2.1.0 got a loose cookie mode which is more how browsers actually behave. It implies an empty key for value only cookies.  Not sure how request handles strict spec compliance vs. practicality  so I thought I d just get this started with a PR.

title: Inconsistency in response.uri when using browserify
body: Problem  When redirects happen  response.request.uri correctly retrieves the URI of the last HTTP request  only when used through node. When it s used through browserify in the browser  response.request.uri gets the first requested URI.    Reproduce     1. Command line works      bash >npm install request > node var request = require  request  ; request.get  http://irail.be   function  err  response   console.log  Now should contain https in the uri:   response.request.uri.href ;  ;         2. Browser doesn t work:  Check out this require bin  use the dev tools console to see the result  where this time  no https redirect was detected by require as it automatically was solved by the browser :  http://requirebin.com/?gist=4c1ffeebbbfae2e8a408    Possible fix  Check if the request was done by a browser and set the uri.href to what the browser returns instead of the requested URL?

title: Proposal    Request readResponseBody
body: There s a cool piece of code [here] https://github.com/request/request/blob/master/request.js L1016:L1065  that one could benefit from if it were extracted and exposed as a function of  Request prototype ... :   If I find some time to do it I ll definitely enjoy contributing. In the meantime I m just dropping those lines for any feedback.

title: Extract  readResponseBody  method out of  onRequestResponse
body: As mentionned in issue  1817 I ve extracted the portion of  Request onRequestResponse  that reads the response s body into  Request readResponseBody .

title: Run stringify once
body: Code seems to be running _qs.stringify twice for no reason.

title: Set href as request.js uses it
body: If href was never defined in an original  dynamically generated request options object the rest of the code referencing href fails.

title: Implement support for RFC 2617 MD5 sess algorithm.
body: Current implementation does not handle the RFC 2617 MD5 sess algorithm. I ve added that ability along with a simple test. I ve also confirmed this is working against an IIS server   the only real world test I have  at my disposal  .

title: Not getting any response using POST
body: I m using  post  and sometimes  depending on the server side  I get no response at all. Not even an error.   I can see how the string  ===========================> Sending update actual time       gets printed. The server side is receiving it and processing it  but then I get no response and  RESPONSE  doesn t even get printed.       javascript router.post  /saveActualTime/   function req  res next        var params = req.body;     params[ uuid ] = req.session.user.uuid;      console.log  ===========================> Sending update actual time       ;     request.post           uri:  res.locals.baseUrl    HaulierPortal/addgateevent           qs: params        function  error  response  body            console.log  RESPONSE  ;  //it doesn t reach this point.         console.log body ;         if  error    response.statusCode  = 200                console.log  error   ;             res.send    ;          else              var data  = JSON.parse body ;             res.json data ;                 ;   ;

title: request usage scenario
body: Initially I tried to use request  since it said it supported URL parsed objects  like this:      javascript var options =     url:       protocol:  https:       hostname:  api       port:  443       pathname:  /services/info       query:         id: 5000              json: true  ; request options  function  error  response  body      // omited  ;      Tracing the code  I found that doesn t work.  For the developers on my team that are also expecting this to work  I added this in our wrapper:      javascript if  request_options.url    request_options.url.query      request_options.qs = request_options.url.query   delete request_options.url.query         The options variable is actually generated from several functions but the above assignment is equivalent.  Would you have expected the options variable to work as is and would you like a patch?

title: Redirected request returns 400 Bad Request status
body: I would like data from booking form on my website to be send to car parks providers website and then I would like to scrap data about availablity and costs of car parks from a car parks booking site to display it on mine.  I am using following request:      js        var form =                TextBox_DateFrom :  16/10/15                Arrive_Time :  32400                TextBox_DateTo :  22/10/15                Return_Time :  64800                TextBox_PromoCode :                  Button1 :  Get My Quote           ;          var formData = querystring.stringify form ;         var contentLength = formData.length;           var options =               followAllRedirects: true              maxRedirects: 20              hostname:  directparking.co.uk  // 5.77.51.55:443               host:  5.77.51.55               path:  /index.php               port:  443               method:  POST               headers:                    Content Length : contentLength                   Content Type : application/x www form urlencoded                    User Agent :  Mozilla/5.0  X11; Linux x86_64  AppleWebKit/537.36  KHTML  like Gecko  Chrome/45.0.2454.85 Safari/537.36                           ;          var r = https.request options  function response               console.log  STATUS:     response.statusCode ;             console.log  HEADERS:     JSON.stringify response.headers  ;           ;         r.on  error   function e                console.log  error:     e ;             console.log  problem with request:     e.message ;           ;         r.write formData ;         r.end  ;      That s what I get in return. I have no idea why there is 400 Bad request error within the Get method. You can have a look at the results from Node Inspector below:  [methodpost] https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/11157817/10515165/5e58c98c 7352 11e5 912d 2a525508dfb5.jpg   [methodget] https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/11157817/10515166/65aedf5a 7352 11e5 9ec8 85e05c54f573.jpg   While I am sending filled in HTML form the requests have correct satus.

title: Better decoding of response bodies
body: In the general case  it would be better if request was smarter about decoding. For example  it shouldn t try to decode requests with  content type: image/png  to a string.

title: Use node s latest version when building
Documentation on ETIMEDOUT   connect not clear
body: Hi  First of all I m not sure i should have opened an issue for this  but I haven t found any other way to ask this question.  Lately I ve been running into these errors :        code:  ETIMEDOUT   connect: false     code:  ETIMEDOUT   connect: true        And I ve been wondering whether the  connect: true  indicated that this was a connection timeout  as the documentation seems to imply  or that a connection did occurred before the timeout  as my tests seem to indicate .  Here s what the documentation says :  > You can detect timeout errors by checking err.code for an  ETIMEDOUT  value. Further  you can detect whether the timeout was a connection timeout by checking if the err.connect property is set to true. >  >     js > // Set to  true  if the timeout was a connection timeout   false  or  undefined  otherwise. > console.log err.connect === true ; >      And here is the code  [request.js l.811 ] https://github.com/request/request/blob/master/request.js L811   :      js var connectTimeout = self.req.socket    self.req.socket.readable === false self.abort   var e = new Error  ETIMEDOUT   e.code =  ETIMEDOUT  e.connect = connectTimeout self.emit  error   e       So it does seem that  connect: true  means connection timeout. But are you sure that a not readable socket cannot occur even when a connection is established ? And when I get  connect: false   I don t know if I had a readable socket or if there was no socket at all  which can be really misleading.  What do you think ? Thanks.

title: Fix Referer header to point to the original host name
body: I have no idea how this has gone unnoticed for so long. Here is how our single test regarding that behavior looks like before and after the change using  request debug :  > should have the referer when following redirect by default      diff   request:       debugId: 1       uri:  http://localhost:6767/temp        method:  POST        headers:          cookie:  foo=bar           host:  localhost:6767            content length : 0         redirect:       debugId: 1       statusCode: 301       headers:          location:  http://localhost:6767/temp_landing            set cookie : [Object]          date:  Fri  23 Oct 2015 08:38:55 GMT           connection:  close            transfer encoding :  chunked          uri:  http://localhost:6767/temp_landing        request:       debugId: 1       uri:  http://localhost:6767/temp_landing        method:  GET        headers:          cookie:  foo=bar; ham=eggs            referer:  http://localhost:6767/temp_landing            referer:  http://localhost:6767/temp           host:  localhost:6767          response:       debugId: 1       headers:           x response :  GET temp_landing           date:  Fri  23 Oct 2015 08:38:55 GMT           connection:  close            transfer encoding :  chunked          statusCode: 200       body:  GET temp_landing           > Referer header should point to the host name of the original resource when redirecting.  Hopefully that s the correct behavior.

title: removeRefererHeader docs
body: in documentation:  > removeRefererHeader   removes the referer header when a redirect happens  default: false .  but actually it doesn t remove Referer  it just reuses its value from initial request like browsers behave . I guess that need to do some corrections in docs about this option.

title: Limit the amount of data request can receive
body: We re ran into an issue where someone passed a 250MB file through request causing node to memleak and die.  It would be great to have a limit that say something like: after you read more than 2MB die somehow.

title: Improve referer header tests and docs
body: Closes https://github.com/request/request/issues/1858

title: Remove redundant call to Stream constructor
body: I m not sure if this is some sort of witchcraft that I m not familiar with  but I would normally not call the parent constructor twice as it have been done now for about a year since ef4016f.  If this is indeed on purpose I think it s one of those rare occasions that deserves a code comment explaining it :wink:

title: In what circumstances does the err parameter get set on a request s callback function?
body: Hi   In this example from the README file:      javascript request  http://www.google.com   function  error  response  body      if   error    response.statusCode == 200        console.log body  // Show the HTML for the Google homepage.             In what circumstances does  error  get set? Looks like  4xx  and  5xx  responses leave  error  as null.

title: No body unless callback is passed as argument
body: I m using request in Swift/Ceph client  I need to be able to pipe response into file if  binary/octet stream  and then call a callback   I m using the events  and if I don t send function into request as second param no body is returned      var req = request params ; req.on  complete   function  response  body      // no body   ;          // passing function as second parameter var req = request params  function      ; req.on  complete   function  response  body      // body available   ;      package.json tells me    version :  2.65.0

title: url.parse exception within redirect.js
body: I am getting the following exception when calling request URL function err res body    ;      URIError: URI malformed at decodeURIComponent  native  at Url.parse  url.js:185:19  at Object.urlParse [as parse]  url.js:101:5  at Redirect.onResponse  /myproject/node_modules/request/lib/redirect.js:104:21  at Request.onRequestResponse  /myproject/node_modules/request/request.js:944:22  at ClientRequest.emit  events.js:95:17  at HTTPParser.parserOnIncomingClient [as onIncoming]  http.js:1692:21  at HTTPParser.parserOnHeadersComplete [as onHeadersComplete]  http.js:121:23  at Socket.socketOnData [as ondata]  http.js:1587:20  at TCP.onread  net.js:527:27       The URL has multiple redirects.  Unfortunately  I don t know the exact URL  since we are processing 1000s of URLs at a time  and couldn t narrow it down.  Made the follow change to the redirect.js module for line 104:      js try       request.uri = url.parse redirectTo    catch err        return false;        Thoughts?

title: Add missing quotes on x token property in README
request 2.65.0  getPeerCertificate    always returns  null  on node 4.2.1  works on 0.12.7
body: From https://github.com/nodejs/node/issues/3545   note that as node 4 s own TLS lib is OK  this seems to be a request issue.    This seems to be a regression between node 4.2.1 and node 0.1.2:      var request = require  request   request     url:  https://github.com     function  err  res  body      console.log  err   err    console.log  peerCertificate:  res.req.connection.getPeerCertificate   ;   console.log  authorized:  res.req.connection.authorized ;   console.log  authorizationError:  res.req.connection.authorizationError ;   ;      First node 0.12.7:        grep ver node_modules/request/package.json    version :  2.65.0     node   version v0.12.7    node testssl.js err null peerCertificate:   subject:      businessCategory:  Private Organization         1.3.6.1.4.1.311.60.2.1.3 :  US         1.3.6.1.4.1.311.60.2.1.2 :  Delaware        serialNumber:  5157550        street:  548 4th Street        postalCode:  94107        C:  US        ST:  California        L:  San Francisco        O:  GitHub  Inc.        CN:  github.com          ...      Then node 4.2.1:        node   version v4.2.1    grep ver node_modules/request/package.json    version :  2.65.0     node testssl.js err null peerCertificate: null authorized: true authorizationError: null

title: Keep alive leads to unhandled ECONNRESET
body: Consider this simple code:      js log  request started  ; require  request         uri:  http://example.com/1       agentOptions:           keepAlive: true          keepAliveMsecs: 15000             => log  request ended   ;  setTimeout    => log  end    150000 ;  process.on  uncaughtException   function err        log  uncaughtException  ;     console.error err.stack ;     process.exit  ;   ;  function log msg        console.log process.uptime      s:     msg ;        An unhandled exception happens when the connection is closed  the server closes it or the computer is disconnected from the network . In this case the output of the code above looks like as follows      0.225s: request started 0.946s: request ended 25.938s: uncaughtException Error: read ECONNRESET     at exports._errnoException  util.js:874:11      at TCP.onread  net.js:544:26

title: Har support   mimeType and charset
body: Chrome 46  Debugger tools Har export.  I tried to repeat a request via har data.  My har file has:  req.postData.mimeType ===  application/x www form urlencoded; charset=UTF 8   but the switch  switch  data.postData.mimeType     in https://github.com/request/request/blob/master/lib/har.js L63 does not expect to have the  ; charset=UTF 8  in here.  The request itself works. But if I modify the postData  it is not recognised as no switch/case matches.

title: Exception fix for malformed urls to url.parse
body: I am getting the following exception when calling request URL function err res body    ;      URIError: URI malformed at decodeURIComponent  native  at Url.parse  url.js:185:19  at Object.urlParse [as parse]  url.js:101:5  at Redirect.onResponse  /myproject/node_modules/request/lib/redirect.js:104:21  at Request.onRequestResponse  /myproject/node_modules/request/request.js:944:22  at ClientRequest.emit  events.js:95:17  at HTTPParser.parserOnIncomingClient [as onIncoming]  http.js:1692:21  at HTTPParser.parserOnHeadersComplete [as onHeadersComplete]  http.js:121:23  at Socket.socketOnData [as ondata]  http.js:1587:20  at TCP.onread  net.js:527:27       The URL has multiple redirects.  Unfortunately  I don t know the exact URL  since we are processing 1000s of URLs at a time  and couldn t narrow it down.  Made the follow change to the redirect.js module for line 104:      js try       request.uri = url.parse redirectTo    catch err        return false;        Fixes  1864

title: FormData Stream => Random ECONNRESET
body: hi   i use request to upload file and i have remarked that sometimes i get an ECONNRESET on client response.  this is a little exemple to reproduce the problem easly :  CLIENT      js     var http = require  http  ;     var request = require  request  ;     var fs = require  fs  ;      function sendfile         var formData =       id:  my_value       data: fs.createReadStream  ./package.json             request.post  url: http://127.0.0.1:9090   formData: formData   function optionalCallback err  httpResponse  body            if  err               return console.error  upload failed:   err ;         console.log  good  ;       ;               setInterval sendfile  1000 ;      SERVER      js      var http = require  http  ;      http.createServer function  req  res                     res.writeHead 200     Content Type :  text/plain    ;          res.end  ;        .listen 9090 ;      with this exemple  i get often this error in client response SOCKET ERROR =>  read ECONNRESET Error: read ECONNRESET. if i don t send the stream in the post request  the problem never happens.  this is the log with NODE_DEBUG=http  on client           HTTP 8276: sockets 127.0.0.1:9090: 1     HTTP 8276: write ret = false     HTTP 8276: write ret = false     HTTP 8276: write ret = false     HTTP 8276: write ret = false     HTTP 8276: write ret = true     HTTP 8276: write ret = true     HTTP 8276: outgoing message end.     HTTP 8276: SOCKET ERROR: read ECONNRESET Error: read ECONNRESET         at exports._errnoException  util.js:874:11         at TCP.onread  net.js:544:26       upload failed:   [Error: read ECONNRESET] code:  ECONNRESET   errno:  ECONNRESET         syscall:  read        HTTP 8276: CLIENT socket onClose     HTTP 8276: removeSocket 127.0.0.1:9090: destroyed: true     HTTP 8276: HTTP socket close      I m on windows  i have try with nodejs  0.12.2 4.1.0 and 4.2.1 and the last request module 2.65.0

title: Error on initialization should prevent actual HTTP request from being sent
body: Hello  Working on a propitiatory piece of app the other day  I ran into a strange exception happening on nextTick. This exception would complain of   can not call method request of undefined  . When I inspected the problem deeply I understood the problem was that the URI which I passed to   request   did not have any protocol defined  like   /bad uri   but also the problem seemed to be triggered because a stream was piped to   request   to upload some files to a WebDAV server. I also confirmed that   request   did in fact call my callback with provided exception error but was still trying to make the actual HTTP request regardless. The exception happened because initialization was failed thus leaving   undefined   variables behind but this case of error was never checked in   Request.write   method which was called in nextTick following stream of data from my file. So I tried to fix this problem by: 1. Creating a test case  which needed [tape catch] https://www.npmjs.com/package/tape catch  to fail tests creating exceptions on process level  2. Setting   self._aborted   to   true   on every error inside   request   3. Checking   self._aborted   in methods   Request.write   and   Request.end   4. Fixing a test case in   test bearer auth   that falsely relied on   request   making HTTP requests regardless of errors in it s initialization  The following is an image showing the stacktrace of exception which I m talking about:   [image] https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/10746709/10868130/c9bcd85e 807b 11e5 8297 78d6d5a53eaa.png

title: Fix tunneling after redirection from https
body: Current stable module  request@2.65.0  cannot handle https to http redirection with proxy properly.  When redirected from https to   http   with  options.tunnel = undefined   the   http   request should be proxied without CONNECT tunneling.  This pull request includes these changes: 1. use  options  again after redirection. 2. fix test case for https to http redirection. 3. fix description about  tunnel  option.  This pull request solves [this problem] https://github.com/atom/apm/issues/322 .

title: Content Length header may not be in defaultProxyHeaderWhiteList
body: In [RFC 7231] https://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc7231.txt   section 4.3.6  it says:   > A payload within a CONNECT request message has no defined semantics;sending a payload body on a CONNECT request might cause some existing implementations to reject the request.  So it is better not have a body in the CONNECT request. From [RFC 7230] https://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc7230.txt   section 3.3.2:   > A user agent SHOULD NOT send a Content Length header field when the request message does not contain a payload body and the method semantics do not anticipate such a body.  since the payload body is not in the request  the  content length  should not be set.  Therefore  the  content length  header should not be in the proxy header white list by default.

title: Fix tunneling after redirection from https  Original:  1881
body: Current stable module  request@2.65.0  cannot handle https to http redirection with proxy properly.  When redirected from https to   http   with  options.tunnel = undefined   the   http   request should be proxied without CONNECT tunneling.  This pull request includes these changes: 1. use initial  options.tunnel  again after redirection. 2. fix test case for https to http redirection. 3. fix description about  tunnel  option.  Closes  1881

title: Support for stale while revalidate and stale if error HTTP headers
body: Hey guys.  My use case requires more flexibility for our HTTP caching  and I found these 2 handy headers  stale while revalidate and stale if error  defined in this RFC:  https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc5861 page 3  I was thinking of working on this and submitting a PR to this request repo.   I was wondering if this is something you guys would consider?  If it s something that would be an outright rejection I will instead just make it a separate NPM module. :   Thanks.

title: SSL error
body: Request version 2.64.0 Node: v4.0.0  Most HTTPS requests work but there s some type of SSL or network error that s causing me grief: TLSSocket can cause a connection error before socket._httpMessage is set. So connectionErrorHandler has an uncaught exception:  request/request.js:80     socket._httpMessage.emit  error   error                         ^ TypeError: Cannot read property  emit  of null     at TLSSocket.connectionErrorHandler  node_modules/request/request.js:80:24      at TLSSocket.g  events.js:260:16      at emitOne  events.js:82:20      at TLSSocket.emit  events.js:169:7      at emitErrorNT  net.js:1250:8      at doNTCallback2  node.js:429:9         at process._tickCallback  node.js:343:17       at Request.onRequestResponse  node_modules/request/request.js:885:25  at emitOne  events.js:77:13  at ClientRequest.emit  events.js:169:7  at HTTPParser.parserOnIncomingClient [as onIncoming]  _http_client.js:415:21  at HTTPParser.parserOnHeadersComplete  _http_common.js:88:23  at TLSSocket.socketOnData  _http_client.js:305:20  at emitOne  events.js:77:13  at TLSSocket.emit  events.js:169:7                at Request.start  node_modules/request/request.js:834:12  at Request.end  node_modules/request/request.js:1394:10  at end  node_modules/request/request.js:564:14  at Immediate._onImmediate  node_modules/request/request.js:578:7  at processImmediate [as _immediateCallback]  timers.js:371:17

title: first argument must be a string of Buffer
body: Hi  I was running some code and got this error message:      _http_outgoing.js:441     throw new TypeError  first argument must be a string or Buffer  ;     ^  TypeError: first argument must be a string or Buffer     at ClientRequest.OutgoingMessage.write  _http_outgoing.js:441:11      at Request.write  /Users/tomasnovella/workspace/kitt/kitt chrome sync/node_modules/request/request.js:1392:25      at end  /Users/tomasnovella/workspace/kitt/kitt chrome sync/node_modules/request/request.js:550:16      at Immediate._onImmediate  /Users/tomasnovella/workspace/kitt/kitt chrome sync/node_modules/request/request.js:578:7      at processImmediate [as _immediateCallback]  timers.js:383:17       Funny thing is  that if I replace the current version of request module with an older one     v2.60.0  2015/07/21   according to changelog   everything works just fine.  The code that causes this error is this:      javascript   request.post           url:  <someURL>           qs:              client :  Google Chrome              client_id : config.clientId                    headers:              Content Type :  application/octet stream              Authorization :  Bearer    accessToken                    encoding: null  //  if you expect binary data         responseType:  buffer            body: body         error  response  body  =>  ..blah...  ;

title: Convert typed arrays into regular buffers
body: Fixes  1904   This bug was introduced in  1733 regarding this issue  1732  Bringing back the code that was removed in  1733. Converting to Buffer happens only when the body is a typed array. That way this won t affect the performance fix for  1732  One additional dependency was needed [is typedarray] https://www.npmjs.com/package/is typedarray

title: Version 2.66 is published on NPM
body: [Changelog] https://github.com/request/request/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md

title: Implement optional additional socket settings control
body: We should be able to configure TCP_KEEPIDLE  TCP_KEEPINTVL and TCP_KEEPCNT for use cases where the socket on the sending side is prepared  but the data is never sent  so we cannot see why the connection is hanging once the net.setKeepAlive   is used.  net keepalive package has this implemented. https://www.npmjs.com/package/net keepalive

title: npm install request creates sshpk as a node_modules even though not in package.json
body: request@2.66.0  Node4.2.2  Has a node_modules sshpk. This is not available in package.json however it gets dowloaded.  Not sure why. Can this be fixed please?

title: Unable to shrinkwrap if the dependency tree contains request@2.66.0
body: This bug seems a bit crazy  but hear me out:  We recently updated some dependencies and tried to shrinkwrap  but shrinkwrap continually fails with extraneous dependencies in the module tree.  It appears to be related to the recent release of request  so:  If I try to shrinkwrap request:      git clone git@github.com:request/request.git npm i   production  /code/opensource/request   npm shrinkwrap npm ERR  Problems were encountered npm ERR  Please correct and try again. npm ERR  extraneous: sshpk@1.6.2 /Users/andrewn/code/opensource/request/node_modules/sshpk      However  if I try:      git checkout d46a4c727ed7368e4625f9204f140904cc3f4478   2.61.1 rm  rf node_modules/ npm i   production npm shrinkwrap     > Success      Note  that I m not actually trying to shrinkwrap request. The problem is that if I try shrinkwrap my module and my module depends on request  then the shrinkwrap for my module will fail with the same error.  I m not sure if this is a problem with  request  or a problem with  npm   most likely it s  npm   but I m reporting it here since other people are likely to experience the same problem  we ve tried this on different developers environments and are getting the same issue   Some details:   npm@2.14.11   node@v0.10.40

title: Bad function name
body: I am having issues with proxies so I am going back through the code and I noticed this in request.js      function setContentLength         ...    var protocol = self.proxy     self.tunnel ? self.proxy.protocol : self.uri.protocol        defaultModules =   http: :http   https: :https         httpModules = self.httpModules          self.httpModule = httpModules[protocol]    defaultModules[protocol]    if   self.httpModule        return self.emit  error   new Error  Invalid protocol:     protocol         ...        This to me is doing far more than just setting content length and could easily cause confusion.

title: Chrome w/401 error  Authentication Required Popup
body: I implemented the code  attached below  to route restful calls to another server where they get processed.  It works terrific by the way  until the other server throws a 401 error.   Firefox correctly processes subsequent javascript  sees the 401 and brings the user back to our login page.  Chrome pops up an  Authentication Required  box asking for a UserName and password.  While the pop up is there  the GET calls show as pending in the Chrome debugger and then finally show as 401 errors when I cancel the popup.        Do I need to do something special to pass 401 errors to Chrome and prevent this popup from happening?      js app.use  /rest   function req  res      var request = require  request  ;   var url = backendConfiguration.servicesBaseUrl    /rest   req.url;   var r = request url ;   req.pipe r .pipe res ;   ;

title: DNS lookup isn t cancelled when timeout is reached
body: Hi   I ve run into a situation where if our Linux device is configured with an invalid static IP  e.g. customer makes a typo in the configuration   DNS lookup takes 40 seconds then times out and  request  fails with the appropriate error   ENOTFOUND  on  getaddrinfo  syscall .  This is an issue in our pre startup script  since passing  timeout: 5000  makes the callback return the error after 5 seconds  but internally the DNS lookup doesn t seem to be cancelled  because node doesn t exit until 40 seconds after the request is made even though none of our code is left running.  My current workaround is to call  process.kill process.pid   on a timeout error  so the device doesn t sit doing nothing for 35 seconds.

title: ETIMEDOUT with new version
body: I ve been running 2.55.0 with iojs 2 in production for several months and never noticed any problem related to request. Last week I upgraded to 2.66.0 with node 4.2.2 and noticed ETIMEDOUT happening regularly. I created an isolated test script confirming that there indeed seems to be something wrong with 2.66.0   node 4.2.2.  Details: I created this test script      JavaScript  use strict ;  let request = require  request  ; let fs = require  fs  ; let json = JSON.parse fs.readFileSync  node_modules/request/package.json    utf8   ; const REQUEST_VERSION = json.version; const NODE_VERSION = process.version;  function ping       request       method:     HEAD       url:        http://a server of mine       headers:     User Agent :  haha        timeout:   5000      time:      true      strictSSL: false      function error  response  body        if  error          console.log NODE_VERSION  REQUEST_VERSION   error   error.code ;       else         console.log NODE_VERSION  REQUEST_VERSION   good  ;           ;    ping  ; setInterval ping  5500 ;      I set up a new centos VM @ DigitalOcean  installed both iojs v2.1.0 linux x64 and node v4.2.2 linux x64. I copied my script into two folders  one with the latest version of request  2.66.0   the other with the npm shrinkwrapped version and dependencies of request 2.55.0. I let both scripts run concurrently over night  the one with the old request using iojs  and the other with node. I just checked the result:  The old version ran 6821 times without a single error. The output is 6821 lines of  v2.1.0 2.55.0 good .  The new version ran 6816 times with four errors. The output is 6812 lines of  v4.2.2 2.66.0 good   and 4 lines of  v4.2.2 2.66.0 error ETIMEDOUT . The errors seems kind of randomly spread out  at lines 703  1686  2159  and 5326 in the output log .  Next  I ll run both scripts concurrently with node 4.2.2  i.e. not with iojs anymore and will report back.

title: Webpack compatibility error
body: I am using webpack to package our server side code.When I bumped the request package from 2.65.0 to 2.67.0. I get this error:      ./web/dist/server.js:153022     module.exports = function     throw new Error  define cannot be used indirect  ;  ;  Error: define cannot be used indirect  webpack:/// webpack /buildin/amd define.js?:1 module.exports = function     throw new Error  define cannot be used indirect  ;  ;

title: Version dependency issue for 0.10.
body: In the package.json  request indicates it has support for engines   node :  >=0.8.0    However  it depends on hawk  3.1.0   which states it has support for engines   node :  >=0.10.32    Hawk 3.1.0 depends on boom  ^2.8.x   Because  I think  of the combo of the caret and the x in  ^2.8.x  boom  on certain versions of 0.10  3.0.0 is installed instead of 2.8.0.   Although boom  2.8.0  had the same engines as request   node :  >=0.8.0    boom  3.0.0 has been upgraded to only support node  4.0.0  and uses the new  const  syntax.  I was able to reproduce this for node 0.10.13 and there is a similar issue open for 0.10.5: https://github.com/request/request/issues/1452. I realise these are very old versions  but it seems to me that support has been dropped accidentally due to changes inside dependencies.  I have raised this issue against hawk as well: https://github.com/hueniverse/hawk/issues/157
